body_html:
Thank you for looking into it.
I'm seeing this in the PyCharm debugging mode.

I think you are right, I missidentified the problem. shp is actually ok, the problem occurs while using
tf.random_normal(shp,mean=0,stddev=1)

This occures inside my _build_graph method of a neural network.

I have the following line:

xtilde = x + noise_level * tf.random_normal(tf.shape(x), mean=0., stddev=1.)

which fails because
while x.get_shape() = (?,?,1)
tf.random_normal(tf.shape(x),mean=0,stddev=1).get_shape() = (?,?,?)

and so the addition fails because the tensors are not of the same shape.

So the problem is that tensorflow.random_normal has fails to be correctly shaped when the last dimension is 1.

body:
Thank you for looking into it.
I'm seeing this in the PyCharm debugging mode.

I think you are right, I missidentified the problem. shp is actually ok, the problem occurs while using 
`tf.random_normal(shp,mean=0,stddev=1)`

This occures inside my _build_graph method of a neural network.

I have the following line:

`xtilde = x + noise_level * tf.random_normal(tf.shape(x),
                                                                    mean=0.,
                                                                    stddev=1.)`

which fails because
while x.get_shape() = (?,?,1)
tf.random_normal(tf.shape(x),mean=0,stddev=1).get_shape() = (?,?,?)

and so the addition fails because the tensors are not of the same shape.

So the problem is that tensorflow.random_normal has fails to be correctly shaped when the last dimension is 1.
